title: Drawing, "Design for a Bracelet", 1800–25
medium:
Pen and brown ink, gray wash, green, yellow watercolor, traces of graphite
Support: off-white wove paper
markings: Stamps: On verso: Museum for the Arts of Decoration Cooper Union
inscribed: In graphite, lower left corner: 4. On verso, in red crayon: B-6
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brandegee, Boston
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

exhibitions.title: Body Language: Jewelry and Accessories from the National Design Museum
